results.title: Comets: time capsules of the solar system
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Media Four Productions and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Animation sequences are combined with live footage to explore the role comets play in contemporary science research about the solar system’s beginnings. Shows how man’s knowledge of comets has evolved from superstitious fear to a growing understanding of their composition and structure.

results.title: Animal homes. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: A number of different animals, insects such as ants and a spider, various birds, a beady eyed and rather charming mouse, and other larger mammals are shown making and living in their homes. The principal uses to which animals put their homes, safety, shelter, food storage and the raising of young, are reiterated as they are found in various species. The human parallel is drawn by a group of children who run into the house when a storm occurs. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Land that came in from the cold
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Shows the ecological succession which has been associated with the retreat of the ice sheet in the Glacier Bay area of southeastern Alaska over the past two hundred years. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Solar energy: how it works
results.brief_description: In order that energy from the sun be used it must be either concentrated, absorbed, trapped or converted. Simple experiments by children and commercial applications provide examples of how this can be done.

results.title: Predation of cossid moth larvae by yellow-tailed black cockatoos
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Shows how the yellow-tailed black cockatoo extracts cossid moth larvae from the trunks of eucalypts and covers other aspects of the behaviour of the bird and its prey, emphasizing the role of evolutionary adaptation. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Operation flower pot
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
The CSIRO is currently involved in the unravelling of the intricacies of the complex ecosystems of the South Australian forest. The film shows an experiment being conducted to determine and measure how plants use water in the forest. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Lucerne: a stronger shade of green
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Lucerne is one of the richest feed crops grown for livestock and an important source of nitrogen for the soil. In 1977 varieties of aphids began attacking this vital crop. This film shows programs begun by the CSIRO to counter the aphid attacks.

results.title: Looking at lobsters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Describes the life cycle of the rock lobster and shows its remarkable moulting behaviour. Notes the work of marine biologists from the CSIRO and WA Department of Fisheries in learning of the factors controlling its population levels, which are crucial to the maintenance of exports.

results.title: Man and the soil
results.brief_description: Examines soil types and the processes used to map soils. Also notes the vulnerability of soils to manmade influences and possible means to counteract these detrimental effects.

results.title: Choking
results.brief_description: Covers first aid for choking in a variety of situations, using practical demonstrations and animation to explain procedures. Also covers aspects of self-help and first aid for pregnant women who are choking.
